name: without
content:

A2 not having or doing something, or lacking something: I left without my umbrella. You look nice without make-up. He went without my knowledge. I couldn't have done it without you. She's strong without being bossy. Do start without me.formal He's not without (= he does have some) good qualities. This is without a doubt (= certainly) the best Chinese food I've ever had. You shouldn't drive for more than three hours without taking a break. Without wanting to be rude (= I don't want to be rude, but), don't you think you need a haircut? See also
do without (something)
go without (something)

Grammar
WithoutThe preposition without means ‘not having something’ or ‘lacking something’: …
Add to word list
Add to word list
not having or doing (something), or not having the use or help of (someone or something): He came out without a coat. He looks younger without the moustache. Thanks for your help – I couldn’t have done it without you. You shouldn’t drive for more than three hours without taking a break. That was without (a) doubt/without question (= certainly) the best vacation I’ve ever had. When you have no money, you just have to learn to do without. Idioms
without fail
without further ado
